When my mother died in January I found this song on YouTube and listened to it on my flight home for her funeral. It truly touched my soul. In my private last moments with my mother I told her what an amazing inspiration she has been in my life and how much Im going to miss her. I guess I listened to this song so much my phone saved it and it began to play as I was holding her hand one last time. When I hear this song it reminds me of everything good that was my mom and how jealous I truly am that I can't have her in my here and now. Ive shared this with friends who have lost loved ones and it helps us all grieve in a sweet loving way. Just wanted to say thank you so much for helping me through losing half my soul.

Good for you Donna, having time with your family is special and so many regret later in life that they didn’t do what is what I think the best time of our children’s younger years.  To watch them grow from a baby to pre - school is one of the funniest and sometimes painful part of our connection with them as a parent.  They are so comical and can cheer us up when we have had little sleep, they cheer us up with their antics and sometimes comments but they can also cause us pain when they are going through pain themselves.  When they are ill we worry so much it does cause us pain because we don’t get the answers or treatment from the medical people.  We want more from them, but that’s part of us being a parent and wanting our children to be treated as special, as they all are and that’s why spending time with them in their pre - school years is a fantastic experience for us and our children.  I could go on and on lol but I won’t.  Just enjoy every minute you have with your family and then come back and give adults some of your time.  Your voice and songs bring so much to people around the world.  God Bless lovely lady 💜💜xx💜💜

My father passed away on December 14th 2018, his one year anniversary is around the corner.  He suffered a massive stroke on Dec 10th and we made the difficult decision to let him pass with dignity knowing there wasn't anything we could do to bring him back.   We chose this song to be played at his celebration of life on December 17th.   It was so very appropriate.  As the one year anniversary approaches, I see the loneliness left behind in my mother.  They were married 62 years.  My father was a saint for all he endured in his years of marriage, we all told him his pedestal in heaven we will only be able to touch his toes when we arrive. :)  But the loneliness my mother now goes through is even more heartbreaking.   You have the voice of an angel and I thank you for this very beautiful song.  It truly was a beautiful touch to his going away.  <3

Merry Christmas Donna to u and ur family hope ghat u have had an amazing time. I to had 3 children under 5 but they r all grown up now.
Ur record Jealous of the Angels was one of the first songs i heard after burying my husband  of 40 years married but together for 45 that was 4 years ago after hearing ur song i had to go and buy the CD which i play all the time along with another of ur albums that a friend bought me. Twice now I’ve been going to see u in concert and both times i was ill so I’m hoping next time ur at a venue nearby it will be 3rd time lucky and i will actually be well enough to come and see u. Ur music is so beautiful it has also helped me get through mental health issues after having a breakdown through the grief of losing my wonderful husband so u can probably understand why it means so much to me to actually be able to come and see u in person.

I absolutely love the song I love it from the very 1st time I heard it and I knew that I was going to play it for my Mom, we also played it at my Grandpa's funeral and had it on a big screen and everybody enjoyed this song and most of the people had never heard it before, one of the guest said I want to have this song for when I go to heaven  She was older and I also said I wanna do it at my service also. loved by so many, but it was. Whenever someone passes I always tell them about  your song and video  and they fall in love with it and how much comfort they get by the  song and video. I still listen to it a lot!!!! Thanks for the opportunity to express what tjis songs to me and so many others!

Today was the first time I heard this absolutely beautiful work of art. A friend and fellow Registered Nurse here in Nova Scotia, Canada posted it on her FB page this morning. I cried throughout the entire song which is highly unusual for me to react to a song in this manner! At the moment, we here in Nova Scotia are dealing with the worldwide Covid-19 pandemic but more importantly we Nova Scotians are all in mourning for the tragic loss of life that occurred in the largest mass shooting in Canadian history that occurred here last weekend. I have shared your gorgeous song with many Nova Scotians who are grieving. I sincerely want to say thank you for giving comfort to so many.

Donna, your voice is amazing. My wife passed away at 53  from COVID 19 on April 19 and Jealous of the Angels hit me so hard because it was exactly how I was feeling when the hospital called me to tell me she was declining rapidly and wouldn’t make it through the night, yet I couldn’t be by her side holding her hand.  She died with the nurses by her side. My wife’s friend actually sent me this song and I haven’t stopped listening to it since. I played it at the cemetery when we laid her to rest. I listen to it 2 times a day, once in the morning while I drive to work and once when I climb in to my bed staring at her empty side of the bed. Thank you for signing that beautiful song.

I'm bawling from my heart.... what a beautiful gift that's being shared for so many tonight through this song! Our friend Lisa passed away, and though I am more of a fb friend as of late, she meant something in my heart, as a woman and a friend, from minute one. We all adored her and she was a beauty! Cancer won in her battle, but she fought that beast! This song was perfect....

I posted this knowing yesterday was Overdose Awareness Day and that too many friends lost their children to this during Covid19, some feeling this world was just too much. Wishing they knew....

I am celebrating a surgery 4 years ago today that had me gone for a bit, unable to be revived, and yet they got me back, there has been a lot through these 4 years since that surgery. 

My Lifer-Bestie lost her husband, and my family my Uncle the day before, 3 years ago, and this song may be nice for when she or my Aunt sit quietly alone with their memories! 

All of these reason, when this song hit my ears moments ago, I knew I had to share it... YOU, my dear, were delightfully touched by God's hands with a voice that works the soul... thank you for letting us hear it and pass it on, and to look into supporting you as we inquire... Amen!!! You rock sister! I'm loving this beyond words... well I found some words, but you get my meaning haahaa... 😉❤😘🎶🎤

🦋🌲Donna My dear, Wishing you everything wonderful... your song touched My Heart deeply because my eldest son Frank passed away February 29th, and he's in heaven with his dad now. This is the first American Thanksgiving without him at the table. I'm originally from Liverpool England. But I live in Dallas Texas, I came here when I was 19 to marry my prince in Boston. We had 3 sons, now two living, thank you for your song and beautiful words. I miss myteo elder sisters in Waterloo, Liverpool so much.  I'm a military Widow and a grandmother and great-grandmother here in the states. And with this virus going around everywhere. I couldn't fly home to be with family when I needed them so much after losing my son, I sure needed that hugs. It is still so surreal the pain of loss never really goes away, but your singing and you're beautiful words of your song helped me very much, this USA Thanksgiving Day. God bless you my dear and when I come to Ireland I'll come and visit you for a cuppa!!! When  I do come home I fly into Manchester Rent-A-Car, go to Liverpool see my sisters, and then we go on the Seakat over to Ireland, it is so beautiful there. Can you send me your website back so that I can share it with all my friends in America on my family in England I know they love it and they can buy your recording.  I'm sending you a big Texas sized hug love to all your precious family. God bless,  Shirley ❤😁🌷🦋

Dear Donna & Colm & family, I have shared this pain of losing a child; your pain never leaves you and you never forget. My loss happened back in 2007, my ex wife carried our first child for 8 weeks into an IVF pregnancy and then one day my ex started feeling pain in her stomach; we went to Accident & Emergency were they sent my ex wife and me to another hospital about 28 miles away. My ex was admitted to a ward and was given a tablet by the nurse and was treated hideously cold by the nursing staff on this ward, not one nice word was said to us. After the event we learned that we were put on a ward were people go to have miscarriages; we did not receive an apology from the hospital to this day.
I am so very sorry for your heartbreak , Donna& Colm & family. I pray that you got to hold your child and that you got to say goodbye unlike what we went through
It’s going to take a long time to get through it but you will do
I pray to Our Heavenly Father that you get through this nightmare

Donna Taggart    Every time I hear this song I cry my eyes out  

For almost five years now my mom has been gone I was her caregiver. We never saw eye to eye for 20 some odd years it was that hate/love kind of relationship between my mom and I  but she never stopped loving me  when she was diagnosed with stage 4 lung cancer (October 10th 2016) my life came crumbling down I spent every waking moment with her taking care of her I finally had the courage to apologize to her for hating her for so long in the shortest time she was with us we got closer than we ever were when the day she passed away I got a phone call you know that bad gut feeling that something was wrong well I had it when I answered the call getting ready to go get my son from the bus stop  the woman who called me asked if she was talking to me  when I said she was she went quiet for a few minutes and said I'm so sorry I wish this was easy to tell you  I wish there was a way to express  how truly sorry I am but your mom just passed away a few minutes ago (November 29th 2016) I  died twice that day  losing my mom  and when I told my son that his grandma was gone he broke down crying and all I could do was hold him in the middle of the driveway knowing I couldn't take his pain away. From 2015 to 2017 I lost 8 family members 

All I'm going to say is if you hate your mom or dad  or even both  let go of that hatred  cause you don't know when its their time to go   you don't know the pain and suffering that you will go through when they are gone  I learned the hard way  even though my mom accepted my apology I hate myself more for not forgiving her sooner

This song changed so much for me. I came across this video shortly after my young mum passed away unexpectedly in August 2016. This song resonated with me, and how my heart was aching, and with WHY is was aching. You don't know how much this song has touched me. I lost my Daddy only a few months after this song came out.  He had 4th stage kryptogenic cirrhosis of the liver. I took care of him for almost 3 years waiting for a liver transplant.  Then when his name finally came up on the list for transplant,  he was too sick to carry on. I was so mad at God, why would he make him fight so hard, if he was going to take him anyway.  A friend sent me your song to listen to. That day I seen why God really took him. My father was in pain and God wanted him to be in peace and pain free. I am still riddled with grief after losing my father,  but I understand God's plan now.

Happy Birthday 🎈

What a beautiful song, sung by a beautiful woman with an angel's voice.  So heartfelt, really tugs at the heart strings.  I lost both my mom and dad without notice, neither one of them had been sick, not that we were aware of, and both died without any warning.  My Dad has been gone 20 years (on September 27th, Monday), heart attack at 69 while at home by himself, died instantly.  My Mom passed just last year, on May 4th which threw us all for a loop.  We hadn't seen my mom since February 16th do to covid and all the lockdowns/health restrictions that were being enforced and she was in a Personal Care Home which was on lockdown.  The last time we seen her on February 16th, she was in good spirits, was enjoying being with her great grandchildren and watching them play around.  I was even discussing with one of them about having Great Grandma's 85th birthday Party celebration (next year, which is this year, October 23rd), and the room we were going to have it in at the home.  My mom and I would talk on the phone while we weren't able to see each other, but it sure isn't the same, especially for the eldery who are on their own or in PC Homes, and have alzheimers/dementia.  I feel that if I was able to see my Mom, even within a day or a few of her passing that she would still be here with us now.  Apparently she was septic when she arrived at the hospital, she was in a septic coma!  That doesn't happen in the shake of a finger!  Had I been able to see her, I know that I would have sensed something wasn't right with her, as I had in the past, and most likely the doctor could have caught what it was before she went septic!  My mom was my best friend, confident, she was my everything and I miss her with my entire being!  Love you Momma, this song is going out to you from me, until we are together again  <3
Thank you Donna for sharing this song for all the world to hear, you my Dear are an Angel.  <3

I happened to be on YouTube browsing songs On November 21,2021 and came across this song.  I thought it was such a beautiful song and saved it not knowing the depth of why.  The following morning, November 22, 2021 at 7:58 am,
I received a call saying my father passed away  unexpectedly.  While in such turmoil, my heart felt comfort in this song.  My dad and I were very close and while I couldn’t express the words, this song was every word I wish I could say.  I have played it every single day for two months.

Hi Donna I like and love your music!

This song has been a blessing to me, since I lost my husband to Covid in 2020.  He was the love of my life, and I miss him beyond any words I could write!  I had them play this song during his service, and cried uncontrollably!  But now, I play this song in my car, when I visit the cemetery.  Jealous of the Angels put into words how I was feeling after losing him.  I cry every time I hear it, but it also brings me peace, to know he’s with the angels!  He was my hero, in so many ways.  I miss him every minute of every day.  Thank you for this beautiful song, that’s helped me through the worst time in my life! 💔💔

My Mommy passed away late Tuesday night after several years battling Alzheimer’s and Dementia. She was diagnosed with Covid last Wednesday, admitted to the hospital on Friday, released in the afternoon on Tuesday, and died that night. We know she’s in Heaven, reunited with our Daddy, and other family members, but more importantly, basking in the presence of God.
